data.title: Good & Tasty Indian Buffet for Lunch
data.text:
The restaurant serves Indian Vegetarian and non vegetarian food. They offer Buffet for Lunch during week days as as well as special Indian Lunch Buffet during week ends. We opted for Vegetarian options as these were our holy days of NavRatra. There were a few limited options for veg lovers. When asked, the waiter answered that they have more of the local guests for Buffet Lunch compared to Indians and that is why, they have more options in Non-Veg food. No issues, the veg options were also very well prepared and were very tasty. Freshly prepared Indian Bread - Naan were served on the table. 
Appreciate very much the response of serving staff. 
Will definitely visit again.

data.title: Huge improvement
data.text: I'm happy again! A huge improvement compared to my last visit! Good food and service - what I had come to expect from this restaurant after many visits. I can put this place back on my "go to" restaurants!

data.title: The best Indian restaurant on the South Shore.
data.text:
We have visited this restaurant probably a couple of dozen times and have never once been disappointed.
Service has always been first class and personable.
The quality of the food is outstanding, all the sauces we have tried were fresh, vibrant and obviously cooked with pride.
The naan breads are perfect, love the little charring you get on the bubbles whilst the surrounding areas are soft and delicious, I'm partial to the garlic naan, but for lighter days, chapati are awesome (ask for no butter though, they get a little oily with it i think)
I have probably been to dozens of Indian restaurants from Boston to Britain and I'm happy this one is not too far away from me. Up until this one opened I had been traveling all the way to another fine Indian restaurant in Arlington. Highly recommend the chicken kadai, Tikka Masala, butter chicken and garlic chicken, and for lamb lovers, any of these with their tender juicy braised lamb is incredible.
Non vegetarian app is great, love the pakora and samosa not to mention the delicious chicken tikka, this app is an all round winner. Although not on the menu, if you ask your sever they will make you onion bahji's, an all time British favorite!
Don't be afraid to order these dishes hot, if you can handle spicy Mexican food or hot chilli's you can handle this and your palate will thank you. Make no mistake, this is not Mexican or a beef chilli, the heat does not come out of a bottle or in flakes. The heat comes from the blend of several exotic spices, it's a slow burn that doesn't always hit you right away, but kinda sneaks up on you and if you like spicy food, your going to love this

data.title: Ok food ok service.
data.text: The food is ok and the service is also ok. Buffets are same , refills are slow , service provider seema uninterested. Options are less, cannot say authentic Indian especially when the name of the food and it's appearance does not even come close. Location is great right outside Quincy center T.

data.title: Lack of management leaves a bad taste
data.text:
We visited the restaurant for their Sunday buffet brunch on 7/24. We arrived at noon and were told by a server that they only opened at 12.30pm. We returned at 12.30pm to find at least 8 tables already occupied. Another server told us that as long as the buffet was set up, they allowed customers in!

While the food remains tasty, the dishes were not replenished. If lunch is advertised as a buffet, the there is a realistic expectation that the food will be available. 

I notified a server that one dish was empty and was told that there would be "about a 2-3 minute wait". So I wait, and I wait, for over 5 minutes. Another server then tells me that the dish will only come out of the kitchen "in about 5 minutes"! I gave up and observed the dish coming out about 10 minutes later at which time, we were ready to leave.

No front of house management to be seen so the lack of oversight made this visit rather frustrating. Admittedly this is our first bad experience, but it was a bad one nevertheless.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: We ordered from the menu.  The naan was fresh and the food was good.  The atmosphere was marginal and the service variable.  One wait staff was very friendly and the other did not give us a welcoming feeling.

data.title: Good food, but avoid downstairs if you can
data.text:
If I were only to review the food and service I would say it was very good. Authentic Indian food that was very tasty, and the wait staff was relatively friendly.

However, at the end of the meal, I went to the bathroom, which was located downstairs. The stairs were very dirty, as the very thin carpet had been permeated with some oily substance... dirt and grease, I suppose, from many years of use. The carpet should have been replaced eons ago. The floor on the lower level was not carpeted so it was slick... again, I suspect dirt and grease... which made walking a wee bit iffy, and the bathroom was not super clean either. That certainly detracted from the entire experience.

I can only hope that the kitchen is kept clean, but I don't want to think about that now.

data.title: My favorite Indian food in Quincy
data.text: Great food, friendly people, and never a long wait.  I love this spot both for dining-in and take-out.

data.title: Our Go-to for Indian Take-out
data.text:
We've been on a kick of satiating our Indian craving with a take-out order from Sher-a-Punjab about every other week or so.  We always order too much so we have make it into a two meal deal for us.  For two people, we order 2 orders of naan, (this time is was garlic and peshawari - last time it was aloo and peshawari), and then 3 to 4 other items that come along with rice for the remainder of the meal. 

We really have enjoyed the chicken tikka masala, the rogan josh and the other dishes tend to depend on how we are feeling about finding new things to enjoy.  Garlic Shrimp was good as well - but it was much saucier than I expected based on the description. 

The take-out order also always comes with the crispy papdum and accompanying sauces/relish which is nice and makes you feel like you're not missing too much by choosing to stay home with the food as opposed to eating out. 
 
We'll be back for sure - and maybe we'll venture to the restaurant itself next time.

data.title: A nice meal at a reasonable price
data.text:
This is my first visit to this restaurant,visiting with my wife & friend.
We ordered a mixture of food which we shared. The main dish was chicken tikka masala,vegetable sumosa,whole grain rice & white rice with several appetizers.The food was very nicely cooked and was served hot.
The only complaint was not even the food but the constant ringing phone of which the volume was very loud,very distracting when trying to have a conversation!
 We did take some of the food home which I have to say was packaged in very sturdy containers which was a nice thought.

data.title: Quite delicious!!
data.text: My friends and I like to try different restaurants every time we get together.  To be honest, we picked this place because we had a Groupon.  But we were very pleased with the menu and variety of different meats and seafood.  The Mango Chicken is a must order and the Seafood Tikki Masala was a great choice!  We ordered their naan and that wasn't anything special but our entrees were delicious!!

data.title: Comfort food India Style in Quincy
data.text:
My son and I tried this place for dinner. Much to my surprise it was quite good. We sat at the bar which had about 15 chairs and you could view the television if you wanted to.

I know nothing about Indian food but my son does so he ordered 3 dishes which came with steamed rice. As much rice as we wanted. We tried a chicken and eggplant dish, a beef with vegetables and a pork tenderloin in a red sauce

As far as the spice we tried Medium. Either Mild or Medium Or Hot. We settled on Medium and it was moderately spicy. Along with some flat bread called nan.

It was good nice clean place and very nice people who served you.

Tom O'Connor

data.title: Delicious food
data.text:
Sher A punjab due to close proximity from our home , is our 9 o clock place to go.

Good food. Nice portions of delicacies served with complimentary papdum and three varieties of chutneys is superb.

My husband loves the gobi parantha there, paneer parantha is my favorite.

Ambience is soothing and can see many non indian visitors at any time of day.

Food is not that spicy as indian food but is still a treat for taste buds.

data.title: Indian food
data.text: The atmosphere is average but the food was good.  I like that they listened to our request and supplied the food cooked to order.  This is important when you have a variety of heat levels.  Had leftovers for lunch, also a plus.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Delicious Indian food! My husband and I went on many occasions my favorite is the tofu bhurji and the baigan bhartha and the pista coconut nan!

data.title: Good food, poor service
data.text:
This was my 2nd time at Sher-a-Punjab. The food is delicious but, unfortunately, extremely slow and poor service on both occasions make me want to return to other Indian fare in Quincy that is just as good.
Our sever did not appear at our table for at least 15

data.title: Great weekend Buffet !!
data.text:
This is right outside Quincy Center Station. Our experience was too good. We visited this restaurant on Saturday and they have buffet option available at cost of 10$ + taxes.
We really enjoyed our food. There was many options under veg as well as non-veg. Worth a visit !!

data.title: Delicious Indian food
data.text: We were there for the Sunday buffet, it was excellent.  The food items are labeled so you know what you are eating and there is just so much variety. Lots of wait staff to answer questions,clear plates and help in any way (like taking pics :) Very very nice

data.title: Excellent food I ever had...
data.text: When I landed in US from India, I was missing Spicy Indian food for a long time and I was craving for Indian food and I was forced to go this restaurant for the first time and later on I forced my friends to visit the place along with me because of its excellent food , mild ambiance , superb hospitality ... hats off !!

data.title: Good local Indian food
data.text: We have been to the Sher-A-Punjab many times with our son who lives in the neighborhood in Quincy.  He is a vegetarian and eats at this restaurant or takes out from it at least once a week. We have been frequenting it for the last two years.  Anytime we are looking for something different, we gravitate to Sher-A-Punjab.  The service is very good and the atmosphere is warm and friendly.  Some people have objected to the televisions around the perimeter of the restaurant, but I don't find them offensive, just unnecessary.  it isn't a sports bar.  The food is excellent from the papadum and the naan to the variety of spicy dishes. (You can request the level of spice that you want)  We always try something new, but my absolute favorite is the Lamb Korma. Top on my list.
